availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William J. Turner (Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Abraham Turner and Hannah Turner. Married to Christina Turner. Father of Thomas J. Turner and Andrew Turner. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Private and 2nd Lieutenant in the 4th Kentucky Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from September 15, 1862, to June 12, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 145.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Precinct 7, p. 35.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 612-613, 628.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0032.
Find A Grave, "William J. Turner (March 2, 1837-March 3, 1921)," Memorial #24489206, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/24489206 (accessed June 5, 2018).
